Package com.gadgetbadget.user.security

Class JWTHandler

java.lang.Object
com.gadgetbadget.user.util.DBHandler
com.gadgetbadget.user.security.JWTHandler
public class JWTHandler
extends DBHandler
This class handles all the JWT related operations including JWT generation, JWT validation, JWT PAYLOAD decoding Generating new RSA Key Pairs, etc. Extends the DBHandler class as there are few methods require local Database Access whenever generating RSA Key pairs or validating JWTs which requires retrieving locally stored JWK values including Public Key.
Author:
Ishara_Dissanayake

  • Constructor Details

    • JWTHandler

      public JWTHandler()

  • Method Details

    • generateToken

      public java.lang.String generateToken​(java.lang.String username, java.lang.String user_id, java.lang.String role) throws org.jose4j.lang.JoseException, java.sql.SQLException
      This method generates expiring enabled JWTs for user authentication purposes.
      Parameters:
      username - user-name of the logged in(validated) user
      user_id - corresponding unique user_id
      role - role id of the validated user
      Returns:
      a valid JWT with expiration enabled for 30 minutes
      Throws:
      org.jose4j.lang.JoseException - Exception is thrown by issues that might occur while generating the JWT by the jose4j package
      java.sql.SQLException - Exception is thrown by issues that might occur while accessing the local SQL database

    • validateToken

      public boolean validateToken​(java.lang.String jwt) throws org.jose4j.jwt.MalformedClaimException, org.jose4j.lang.JoseException
      This method validates JWT Token for User Authentication
      Parameters:
      jwt - JWT in the form of a String
      Returns:
      Validity of the token as a boolean value
      Throws:
      org.jose4j.jwt.MalformedClaimException - Exception is thrown when there are issues with validation JWT claims
      org.jose4j.lang.JoseException - Exception is thrown when there are format/encoding issues in the JWT

    • generateRSAKeyPair

      public void generateRSAKeyPair​(java.lang.String key_id)
      Generates a new RSA Public Key Private Key pair and Stores it in the local database under the given key id
      Parameters:
      key_id - a unique identifier given for each RSA key pair generated

    • updateJWKInDB

      public boolean updateJWKInDB​(org.jose4j.jwk.RsaJsonWebKey rsa, java.lang.String key_id)
      This method saves RSA Keys to Local database for future JWT validations which were generated using these RSA keys. Since RJK is already saved in the database, an UPDATE query is written instead of an INSERT.
      Parameters:
      rsa - RSA JSON KEY with Public and Private Key components
      Returns:
      returns a boolean value based on the database operation status

    • insertJWKToDB

      public boolean insertJWKToDB​(org.jose4j.jwk.RsaJsonWebKey rsa, java.lang.String key_id)
      This method inserts RSA Keys to Local database for future JWT Generating. Highly useful when a new pair of Keys needed in a special case such as a security breach or an emergency.
      Parameters:
      rsa - RSA JSON KEY with Public and Private Key components
      Returns:
      returns a boolean value based on the database operation status

    • getJWKFromDB

      public JWK getJWKFromDB​(java.lang.String key_id)
      This method retrieves RSA keys from local database preferably when there is a JWT to be validated. The two Keys Public and Private are retrieved as byte arrays and then converted into preferred types using java.security package.
      Parameters:
      key_id - unique RSA key id in local database
      Returns:
      returns the JSON WEB KEY created including the public and private keys stored in the database

    • decodeJWTPayload

      public com.google.gson.JsonObject decodeJWTPayload​(java.lang.String jwt)
      This method decodes the JWT PAYLOAD of a given valid JWT while authenticating. Typically used by the Authentication Filter implemented to validate JWTs.
      Parameters:
      jwt - a valid JWT user/service authentication token
      Returns:
      returns a JSON object with decoded PAYLOAD of the given JWT

    • generateServiceToken

      public java.lang.String generateServiceToken​(java.lang.String service_name, java.lang.String service_id, java.lang.String service_role) throws org.jose4j.lang.JoseException, java.sql.SQLException, org.jose4j.jwt.MalformedClaimException
      This method is used to generate JWT service authentication tokens for authenticating and authorization purposes of web services while service-to-service communication establishment. JWTs generated for web service authentication are time insensitive, which means the time of the expiration of the JWT is not specified in the list of claims.
      Parameters:
      service_name - unique name of the web service which the JWT is to be generated
      service_id - unique service id given for the web service. usually given manually
      service_role - 3 char prefix given for services which is uniquely mentioned in the ServiceTypes ENUM class
      Returns:
      returns a valid non expiring JWT for unique service authentication
      Throws:
      org.jose4j.lang.JoseException - JWT format/ JWT claim assigning issues
      java.sql.SQLException - SQL issues while retrieving values from the local storage
      org.jose4j.jwt.MalformedClaimException - JWT Verification Exceptions

    • validateServiceToken

      public boolean validateServiceToken​(java.lang.String jwt) throws org.jose4j.jwt.MalformedClaimException, org.jose4j.lang.JoseException
      This method validates JWT Token for Service Authentication
      Parameters:
      jwt - JWT in the form of a String
      Returns:
      Validity of the token as a boolean value
      Throws:
      org.jose4j.jwt.MalformedClaimException - Exception is thrown when there are issues with validation JWT claims
      org.jose4j.lang.JoseException - Exception is thrown when there are format/encoding issues in the JWT
